mxCell.value: Title: This is a blog post
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.
Where do images get physically stored?
How do images *get* to the place they should be stored?
How do we relate images to a particular blog post?
We pay per GB of mongo storage we use.  Mlab, for example, charges $15 per GB per month.  Thats ~330 pictures that are 3mb large
Solution #2 - In HD Attached to Server
Solution #2 - In HD Attached to Server
Doesn't work well with horizontal scaling
Extremely cheap storage - $.023 per GB per month.  Easy backups. Scalable - we never worry about size
Only signed in users should be able to upload
We should only allow images (.jpg, .png, etc) to be uploaded
The uploaded image needs to be tied to the blog post that's being created
Only signed in users should be able to upload
We should only allow images to be uploaded
The uploaded image needs to be tied to the blog post that's being created
Directly concerned with logic in our Express API
1 - Client tells server it needs to upload a file to S3.  Includes file name and file type
2 - Server asks s3 for a presigned URL
3 - S3 gives server a presigned URL.  Works *only* for a file matching the original file name
4 - Server sends url to React client
React client uploads image file directly to s3 server
React client tells server the upload was successful.  Server saves URL of that new image with the blog post

Local Dev Environment Option /  TCA JS
+ DB
+ FS
Random malicious user storing movie files
Issue POST request to backend API to create a blog post
Navigate the user back to the list of blogs
Tell the Redux side of the app about the new blog post that was created
URL can only be used for a single file upload
Users cannot spam our s3 bucket with many files
URL encodes the file name and type of file
User cannot request a URL for one file then upload a different file
URL is generated by a secure request between our server and AWS
User's cannot 'fake' their own upload URL
URL only works for the S3 bucket it is created for
User cannot use the URL for some other bucket that belongs to us
Prevents some exploits, like a malicious user trying to get a URL from another user
Issue POST request to backend API to create a blog post
Navigate the user back to the list of blogs
Tell the Redux side of the app about the new blog post that was created
Issue GET request to backend API to request a presigned URL
Use the presigned URL to upload the file to AWS S3
Name of the operation we want to create the presigned URL for
Name of the bucket we are uploading to
Name of the file we are uploading
'ContentType' of the file that will be getting uploaded
